result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley M. Kent

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Bradley M. Kent appeared with Attorney Martin Jarvis.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances.  Also has 16 CM 87 & 16 CM 142.  Atty  Jarvis offers a plea questionaire and waiver of rights form.  Court finds the def. freely and knowingly waives his rights.  Court finds there is a factual basis.

16 CM 01- Dismissed-Read-In

16 CM 87
Count 1-Dismissed Read-In
Count 2-Def. pleas guilty, Court accept plea and finds the def. guilty.
Sentencing--15 Days County Jail. Must report Friday 7/22 by 4pm. + costs.

16 CM 142--New case, signing up for program. Set out for more time.
Status conference on July 18, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant, Bradley M. Kent appeared with Attorney Martin Jarvis.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances. Set out for status.  Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Status conference on April 18, 2016 at 11:15 am.
Defendant, Bradley M. Kent appeared.  Court calls case and appearances.  Court speaks to the Def. re: an attorney. Court orders to return to the public defenders office to find a lawyer.

Defendant, Bradley M. Kent appeared.  Court calls case and appearances.  Waived reading. Not guilty plea is entered.  Mr. Kent to apply for a dean appointment.  Bail will continue.  Status conference scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.
